title.narrative: Promoting Protection, Fire Mitigation and Ensure Flood Safety for IDP Men, Women, Boys and Girls in IDP sites in Dana and Maaret Tamsrin

description.narrative:
The project aims at providing integrated shelter and CCCM services to enhance protection from floods, fire risks, protection risks, and to promote safe and dignified living conditions for 9290 Households (HHs) of IDPs living in 29 camps and IDP settlements, especially for women, girls, and people with disabilities (roughly 54144 individuals disaggregated as 11906 men, 12988 women, 14617 boys, and 14783 girls) in Idleb governorate, sub-districts of Dana (Bab El Hawa, Deir Hassan, Dana and Kafr Deryan communities), and Maaret tamsrin subdistrict (Haranbush, Kafr–Kafrehmul, Kelly, Ma'arrat Tamsrin, Murin (Maaret Tamsrin), Shekh Bahr, Batenta and Zardana_Mashehad communities) in addition to providing capacity building to develop CCCM cluster member organizations awareness to good practice and effective camp management, which impact will be positively reflected on the camps run by these NGO in NWs.
In the shelter components, the project will provide critical improvement to infrastructure in 19 IDP sites, about 6846 HHs roughly 40482 men, women, boys and girls, who suffered from floods last year, including tent ground leveling, drainage channels and road maintenance in order to mitigate the impact of weather conditions, prevent flooding and facilitate access to shelter, WASH facilities and other services in the camp to ensure better protected and dignified living conditions.
The CCCM component will target 28 IDP sites (18 camps are targeted by the shelter component in addition to 10 camps, where SDI is also implementing similar shelter activities under another project to ensure complementarity) with 8840 HHs, 51834 individuals, to ensure the safety of IDPs and enhance protection against fire incidents that might happen on large or small scale. The intervention will focus on two aspects in consistence with Fire Response TF guidance: 1. Increase the awareness of IDPs residing in those camps on safe practices against fire incidents from small to large scale, causes and harmful effects the targeted age/sex groups will include children and women. 2. Set up fire units within targeted camps and equipping them with necessary tools (fire kits) in addition to selecting one of out of every 75 IDPs, (total 681 IDPs) voluntarily to be trained on firefighting of fire ranged from low to medium scale by a technical team from SCD (Syrian Civil Defense).
The project will also support the CCCM cluster to provide capacity building and develop awareness and competence of CCCM cluster member NGOs in using guidance, tools, and prepare to contribute effective camp management response through a series of three trainings in Syria covering 75 field staff and also three trainings in Turkey covering 75 management staff (25 participants per training) with total of 150 participants in all training/workshops while focusing on camp management standards, roles amp responsibilities, protection, coordination, community participation, information management, and safety amp security in IDP sites.
The intervention will ensure accountability to the affected population, and compliance with IASC standards and international principles in relation to GBV, PSEA, and inclusion and accessibility of people with disabilities while avoid causing harm to occupants of these camps.
